commentary.revenue_performance: Consolidated revenue grew by 5.1% in INR terms. Rural consumption grew ahead of urban for the first time in three years. India business volume grew by 4.2%.
commentary.profitability: Adjusted Operating Margin was 20.2%. Gross margins expanded by 280 basis points. A&P investments increased by 33%.
commentary.business_outlook: Management is optimistic about a gradual uptick in consumption driven primarily by rural. Expects a mid- to high volume growth in FY25.
commentary.key_challenges: The quarter faced a high base and **unseasonal rains** in March, impacting the seasonal portfolio. DABUR incurred a cost of Rs 105 crores in FY24 for the **Namaste LLC legal case**.
commentary.strategic_initiatives: Distribution reach expanded to 1.22 lakh villages through 22,000 Yodhas. Therapeutic division (Doctor Advocacy) scaled up with a turnover of over Rs 120 crores.
commentary.market_conditions: Input cost environment was **largely benign** due to deflationary trends. Rural volume growth became positive after 3 years.
